entries.meaning: One who makes observations, monitors or takes notice
examples: Most impartial observers agreed that Sampras had not served well.

entries.meaning: One who adheres or follows laws, guidelines, etc.
examples: I shall be an observer of the local customs.

entries.meaning: A person sent as a representative, to a meeting or other function to monitor but not to participate
examples: The UN sent many observers to the country's first elections.

entries.meaning: A country or other entity which has limited participation rights within an organization.
examples: The Vatican and Palestine have observer status at the UN.

entries.meaning: (military) A crew member on an aircraft who makes observations of enemy positions or aircraft
examples: The only crew-member to survive the crash was the Canadian observer.

entries.meaning: (military) A sentry etc. manning an observation post
examples: We waited till dusk when the observers' vision was poorest.
